website_summaries.verdict: Plenty of power in a generator that can run from either gasoline or propane, which is a handy option.
pros: Plenty of power to operate the appliances you'll need while camping
Ability to run from gas or propane
Runs more quietly than most generators its size
Includes an easy electric start option
on a full tank of propane
cons: Doesn't offer as many watts when running from propane

customer_reviews.title: Failed out of box. Amazon promptly sent me new generator which works great.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed my brand new Champion 3400 failed to run right out of box. Start engine tried, but unit failed to turn over. Champion told me to take it to a service dealer who I am familiar with. They do great work but are very busy and will no doubt take a couple of weeks to resolve. Meanwhile summer ticks away. Based on reviews and You Tube videos , I was excited to get this generator and am very upset it failed completely. Don’t they test these things? Update 7/5-contacted manufacturer recommended authorized repair shop. They stated that they were not authorized to work on dual fuel. Returned unit to Amazon with replacement due 7/9.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Kronberg

customer_reviews.title: brand new generator won't start on propane.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this generator to specifically start on propane. It won't. No matter what, it does not operate as advertised. Already have lots of gas generators. don't need another. Wanted a propane generator. This is a $1000 dollar paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: brianrm2358

customer_reviews.title: Issues upon delivery.
customer_reviews.text: Didnt work right out of the box. I received it Friday evening and I set it up following instructions, the engine started right up using propane. However, it runs a little rough and it produces no electricity. No circuit breakers are tripped, the green power light is not lit. The econ mode switch doesn't do anything. I called the support line, and they have banking hours. I couldnt reach them, so I sent an email. I opened the cover and there is corrosion and liquid ( battery acid? See pics ). I will update if I am able to get in contact with support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Broken
customer_reviews.text: Came out of the box BROKEN. How do I get a replacement?
customer_reviews.author: Flower Child

customer_reviews.title: This generator is fantastic! We have taken it RV camping twice now ...
customer_reviews.text: This generator is fantastic! We have taken it RV camping twice now and have been able to run it for 8 hours a day, 3 to 4 days on a single propane tank. It easily powers the A/C, TV and Fridge. Very quiet compared to our older Briggs unit. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price/value. I already have two Honda 2000's
customer_reviews.text: Great price/value. I already have two Honda 2000's. I use them with my RV trailer and also as backup for the house when the power goes out. I love my Honda's so I was a bit skeptical about another brand and also the noise. I wanted a dual fuel option and also one that could power my 30amp AC on the RV. This generator is just slightly louder than the Honda's but not enough to really notice. Power wise, it's great. I love that it comes with the handle and wheels. I would buy another one of these when/if the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Cooper

customer_reviews.title: A great generator-and it IS quiet
customer_reviews.text: The generator worked flawlessly out of the box. Pros: quiet, fairly light and easily movable with included wheels, plenty of power for my small RV. Runs TV, Fridge, 5000 btu. air conditioner, and all power sockets simultaneously. Running on propane is a boon, as propane does not degrade over time. Electric start works great. Got a really good deal from Amazon. $200 lower than any other price I have seen. Cons: starting with pull starter is a bit tricky, but electric start works so well I may never need it. Everything else great!
customer_reviews.author: maddy

customer_reviews.title: Emergency power
customer_reviews.text: This generator is exactly what I wanted. I run the gen exclusively on propane so that I don’t have to worry about stale gasoline and the possibility of a fouled carburetor when I need it. I installed a transfer switch to use this to power 6 circuits in my house in the event of a power outage. It can run the heater, master bedroom and bathroom, the refrigerator and stove in the kitchen, and the circuit that powers our internet and router/wireless network. Have tested everything and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: soaked with oil, new in the box
customer_reviews.text: I just pulled the new generator out of the box, and found the entire end and back of it soaked in oil. I tried calling customer service, but was disconnected after being on hold over 30 minutes. I'm not going to keep something that's this much of a mess, and possibly broken. I had the impression that it came dry, so have no idea where so much oil could have come from. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Willie

customer_reviews.title: Propane valve input stopped working mid first day
customer_reviews.text: We simply must have gotten a bad unit. The propane input stopped working mid trip, then switched to gas. The unit worked, but then we had issues with the unit leaking gas. We ordered a new one, problem solved. I suggest not wasting your time with tech support, if its broken, then it's broken.... It can happen to anyone so not upset. The new one has been great so far. Will readjust the review in 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Whispering Barrels

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet and efficient Generator
customer_reviews.text: This generator is great! I chose to go dual fuel because I intend to run it exclusively on propane. It is clean fuel and this generator just sips it. During the recommended break in period I only used about 2.5lbs of Propane! It runs the tools I need such as a tile saw and grinder with no fuss. It cranks up off of Economy mode when I first start each tool, but settles back right away. Great price for a great product. I can use it all day with just the little 10lb propane bottle that you see in the pic!
customer_reviews.author: PC in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic generator, super support!
customer_reviews.text: Size is nice. Powers my spotcooler AC with no problems. Good clean power. Runs on Gas or Propane! Priced well below the competition and has features they don't even offer. I added an exhaust adapter , 90 elbow and muffler to direct the exhaust upward. Perfect for my set up. I bought two more! Gotta keep my crew cool too :) One arrived with a broken regulator. Champion support sent out a replacement quickly, and a Tee Shirt too! Awesome! Great generator and support. Well done Champion.
customer_reviews.author: Brule Lehman

customer_reviews.title: Very nice..
customer_reviews.text: First class construction. This generator is a definite keeper. Only used it with propane so far. Did my five hour break in, adjusting the demand. Electric start, come s with it's own trickle charger, immediate start up, haven't needed the pull start, but that is included also. Very nice... Thanks Champion!
customer_reviews.author: Jaff  Moroby

customer_reviews.title: Portable easy power. Quiet!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Glorious. Very quiet, easy to start. Easy to move with the folding handle and wheels. Very clear instructions and controls. The propane/gasoline switch is easy. Delivers power efficiently, I ran a welder, compressor, industrial drill and several items on it without trouble. Lightweight, easy to lift into your truck bed. Downside is no hour meter.
customer_reviews.author: busyguy

customer_reviews.title: Bad battery, wont start!
customer_reviews.text: I had to call the help desk to start it. It turns out the battery was bad and if the battery gets below 10 amps, the generator won’t start on the gasoline side of things. You can still start it on propane with the pull string but no dice on the gas side. They are supposed to ship me a new battery, but they are out of stock. I had to purchase one on amazon for $27.00. For the price you pay for the generator, you would think they would send you a good battery. Not please at all, thinking of returning it soon!
customer_reviews.author: mario morales

customer_reviews.title: the propane does not smell strong like exhaust from burning gas
customer_reviews.text: Finally used my generator while tailgating. The unit ran for almost 48 hours on propane. I have a small RV that does not demand much power so my estimation for my needs is one 20lb propane tank per about 11-12 hours. Propane tanks are much safer and easier to transport than gas. No worries about spilling gas. Also, the propane does not smell strong like exhaust from burning gas. The until was comfortably quiet. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JBO

customer_reviews.title: Best electric start propane generator i could find.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Electric start 3kw + propane for < $1500 Yay! -Eco-mode = quiet idle, fuel efficiency and long run time with light/intermittent loads. Cons: - non-standard regulator setup; won't work with generic camper regulator, and it's not obvious where to get a replacment. - Tiny plastic wheels; useless unless you are on a hard, smooth surface. On anything else, you are just dragging it.
customer_reviews.author: Lazarus

customer_reviews.title: Cannot Be Repaired
customer_reviews.text: After the first was delivered as a dud, the second was well used and performed well for 18 months. After that time it sat, with ethanol fuel, and the system got gummed up. When I went to tear it down to clean out the carburetor etc it became clear that this is a sealed system that is not meant to be repaired. I know that it is my fault to let it sit, but not being able to repair a $1k generator is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke 4

customer_reviews.title: Insurance for Bad Times
customer_reviews.text: This Champion 3400 dual fuel generator fits all my needs. It has a relatively small footprint; it's features include propane power, 12v USB output, manual and electric start, decent wheels with handle, quiet operation, and economy mode for fuel efficiency. It started right up when tested and is now, on float charge, ready for any PG&E power shutdown. The Champion is my peace of mind insurance against the stress of potential and real loss caused by prolonged electrical power outage. I am giving 5 stars for its ease of operation and features. The test of time remains to be seen, but I am hopeful given the propane power mode.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Awesome generator
customer_reviews.text: Awesome generator! Love the dual fuel option. Wish it had the remote start, but that’s the only con! Runs my LQ horse trailer with ac running all night! Could be a little quieter, but still an awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Alisha Graves

customer_reviews.title: Essential Power Back-up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 3400-watt dual fuel generator for back up in case of power outages. After receiving it, completing the break-in process for 5 hours on about 3 quarts of gasoline. It started perfectly fine every time. But the engine surged a little. Took out the spark plug and measured the gap, it's around 0.022in. The specs said it should be around 0.028 - 0.031in. Adjusted the gap and started the engine, now it sounds absolutely like music to the ear. I was thinking about replacing the original spark plug with the NGK iridium BPR7EIX. This will last longer and no foul.
customer_reviews.author: Rookido

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it
customer_reviews.text: Spending the summer in FL due to Covid19 and thought it about time I purchased an emergency generator. Two friends on the block had the Champion 3100W dual fuel inverter and it got them through Hurricane Irma, so I thought I'd give it a try. Right out of the box, added oil, hooked up my 20lb propane tank and......vroom, started up on second flip of electric switch. Enough power for 1000 W fridge, bedroom, bath and kitchen LED lights, TV, Internet and plenty of power to spare if needed. Quiet little beast, especially on economy setting. Installed 50A breaker so I have the option if needed to run two in tandem. Would buy again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: This Unit is a powerhouse!
customer_reviews.text: I Don’t do many reviews but had to take time for this. I purchased a 10 circuit transfer switch and set it for 120v. On propane this thing ran my full kitchen, dining room, a bathroom, master Rm, guest Rm, garage doors, septic pump, and 2 other bedrooms! Without ever struggling! I’m so impressed with Champion!!
customer_reviews.author: DBLOGIC

customer_reviews.title: Quiet.
customer_reviews.text: We havent had this long but so far so good. I installed this in a deck box with an exhaust extension. Insulated the deck box. Adding some vents and a 12 volt fan to make sure it stays cool. I need to buy a decibel meter but it was already really quiet on eco mode now even more so. We did this to not disturb other campers. We are only running off propane and the deck box holds 2-30lb tanks.
customer_reviews.author: R. Holley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So Far so good.... Haven't even used Gas in it.... The LP option is great. UPDATE: Generator running My 15k Btu Dometic AC on camper.... on LP Side note, There is a sticker on the Top of generator stating that you should maintain 5' clearances around all sides.... Yet they give you a 1.5' Propane hose, so your bottle has to sit within that distance.... Champion: EVERYONE wants that hose to be longer... even you.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: better than most
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent inverter generator. Being dual fuel capable is a good idea. It does run the AC and microwave in the RV but, being that I camp at high elevations (8000 ft+), it does bog down quite a bit when I turn the AC on. I wish I would have known that these inverter generators lose efficiency at higher altitudes. If I would have known, I would have bought a much larger one.
customer_reviews.author: C Hal

customer_reviews.title: I would still buy this generator if I did the research again.
customer_reviews.text: We love this generator. It's not the quietest of all generators, but it performs very well and is super reliable. I've only run it on propane, so no nasty gasoline spills or smell inside my van where I can keep it nice and safe between uses. Runs our 13,500btu AC unit without any trouble, even when running on propane. Also powers our 90-amp battery charger with nice, clean, sine-wave AC. Would not trade it for a super-quiet (super-expensive) or any other generator.
customer_reviews.author: WINSLOW

customer_reviews.title: Awesome generator!!!,
customer_reviews.text: My hats off to you champion a great investment for my RV and my home I can honestly say the best thing about this generator is it’s dual fuel capabilities I have never put gas in it and never planning on putting gas in it because gas Is just going to gum up the carburetor. I’ve been putting some serious hours on the generator with a fairly heavy load and it’s never skipped a beat. My only complaint is that it doesn’t have a remote start !!!
customer_reviews.author: C & M

customer_reviews.title: Great Generator for Home Blackouts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the electrical blackouts we’ve been experiencing. It worked wonderfully. It rolls easily into position, (Wheels are included) starts easily, and it’s quiet. With the windows closed at 40 feet away, I can’t hear it. I have only used it with propane as the fuel. After over 24 hours of continuous operation there is no smell of exhaust. A 20# bottle lasts me about 22 hours. I ordered it through Amazon and it arrived in 3 days. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: K BREDAHL

customer_reviews.title: this has been an excellent generator so far and easily powers everything in my ...
customer_reviews.text: this has been an excellent generator so far and easily powers everything in my 21ft travel trailer. I can run the microwave, refrigerator, rooftop ac, and vent fans all at once with little to no strain on the generator. The dual fuel option is another great feature. The small fuel tank is a slight concern but hopefully we can find an extended run fuel cap adapter in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Richmond

customer_reviews.title: The battery for starting it wont hold a charge
customer_reviews.text: running on propane on a rv trailer..A/C starts ok but unit overloads after a while of running Im going to do a service on A/C unit and see how it works. Battery didn't hold enough charge to start it within a week after i hooked it up to the cables. Luckily it starts with a couple pulls....Runs pretty quiet and I like the feature that you can leave it in standby and it picks up the load
customer_reviews.author: jerry

customer_reviews.title: great alternative to the overpriced honda
customer_reviews.text: nice unit. i'm breaking it in on propane now. works good. i'm hacked a drok led volt/amp meter into a j-box on the cord as this has no meter. also i put an inductive hour meter on it too to know when it is due for maintenance. i'm going to use it as an emergency generator for the house....with an HPS Fortress 120x240 -120/208/240/277 step up transformer to power both sides of my house panel. (wish they made a quiet inverter unit this size iwith split 120/240 output) .
customer_reviews.author: NorCal Jim

customer_reviews.title: but sounded like it rev'd every now and then
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get this today. I opened the box and it's got a couple scratches on it, bummer. I thought it came with oil, but it didn't, so I ran out and got some. It started no problem, but sounded like it rev'd every now and then. I tested with propane and I'll get in the 5 hours and oil change this weekend. At that point, I'll give it the test with the trailer and the ac. I was able to get it off the truck by myself, but it took my sons help to get it up there. I'm hoping the weight is more of a security feature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice generator, easy to use and setup
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a portable dual fuel generator, well the propane part didn't work and after 6 weeks they approved the return, so I needed a new one. After lots of research, the champion inverter dual fuel here was highly recommended. Pros: + easy to use + electronic start + easy to switch to propane + economy mode works well + came with propane regulator + wheels and handle Cons: - battery hookup for electronic start is challenging to hookup - no turnoff. With propane you have to shut the propane tank off to turn it off
customer_reviews.author: Todd Yolish

customer_reviews.title: So far very happy with this generator
customer_reviews.text: So far very happy with this generator. Haven't used it much yet, but it starts right up on propane and runs well. A little disappointed I had to contact service because despite starting and running great it didn't produce any power. Turns out a wire had come unplugged from the controller. I had to take off a back panel and it was obvious and easy to fix. The only other thing that I was unaware of and didn't see in the manual is that the only way to turn it off when running on propane is to turn off the gas. Not a big deal, but I thought I was doing something wrong initially when the off switch didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to start and use. Mind your elevation
customer_reviews.text: A fine machine, starts easy every time, both on gasoline or LPG. Runs smoothly. All internal combustion engines loose power as elevation increases, due to rarefied atmosphere (unless they have oxygen sensors and mixture computers.) Also, more carbon is produced that fouls the engine. Call Champion for a free orifice for the carburetor. You need to be handyman to install the orifice. Instructions are not thorough. Champion please post an instruction video on the procedure to install the orifice.
customer_reviews.author: GGS Engineering

customer_reviews.title: Had to add a start capacitor to my brisk air ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to add a start capacitor to my brisk air 2 as it would not start it even with eco off. With the capacitor added the generator blips a bit and goes back to a near idle. Even right next to my popup you could barely hear it with the ac running. Fill it up at midnight and it was still humming away at 7am.
customer_reviews.author: PimpMyPc

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have one.
customer_reviews.text: I Love this generator. Nice and quiet, runs our entire camper flawlessly and has power to spare. The fact that you can run either lp, or gas is a distinct advantage. If you use lp exclusively, you never have to worry about stail gas or storage over winter. Plus when our power was out for 3 days, we had enough power to run 3 refrigerators and freezers, and watch tv, without any interference.
customer_reviews.author: N P

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: During our RV'ing camping trips we have used several different brands of inverter generators over the years, but this one appears to be the BEST WE HAVE EVER USED. I'm not sure if its because of the dual fuel aspect of it, or if its just because it is so simple to use and light weight that we are so satisfied with, but either way we are happy to have it. We run 2 of the 3400 Champion generators to power our 40ft 5th wheel which has all the conveniences of home (3 televisions, 2 air conditioners, etc. etc.) and they power the RV just like plugging into a hard wired 50amp circuit.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful and worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: I am beyond impressed with this generator. So incredibly easy to use. I have only ran it with propane and don't plan on using the gasoline option but I love having the backup there if needed. I have a small travel trailer and it ran the ac unit with no problem. I live in a very small town and we lose power from time to time so I am happy that j will have this for backup if and when I need it. It is spendy but worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Trina

customer_reviews.title: Champion didn't let me down - awesome generator
customer_reviews.text: I was researching and debating between either a Honda or Yamaha generator. During my search, I found that Champion made a duel fuel generator. I have a Champion log splitter and it is the best log splitter I have owned. Seeing the Champion had all the features I was looking for and at an attractive price point, I purchased it. The setup was easy and straight forward. Hooked it up and it did a great job. Very pleased and would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Quiet power at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: We purchased our Champion dual-fuel generator just a few months ago for use at our off-grid mountainside camp. It's very quiet, easy to use / maintain and sips propane. (with light loads, we see 18+ hours of run time from a 20lb propane tank). Enough power to easily run a 12.5KBTU A/C - Starts every time with a push of a button. Although we've only had it a few months, we've got a couple hundred hours on it and it's proven itself to be a reliable device. Extremely happy with this generator and thinking of buying a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Whoppo

customer_reviews.title: dual fuel is perfect
customer_reviews.text: ran great after set up right out of the box. dual fuel is super easy to use. I purchased for my fifth wheel and also got a 30lb propane tank and it runs about 25 hours in eco mode so I don't have to get up in the night to add fuel which is exactly what I wanted. I can run on gas for 7 hours while I go to refill propane so I'm never out of power. great generator for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Baggett

customer_reviews.title: Dual fuel out of the box
customer_reviews.text: We are using this generator inverter for occasional power requirement for our RV. We are going to use this with our RV when we boondock and our solar isn’t sufficient to recharge our batteries. I will modify the inverters regulator for use with my low pressure RV ports. Unit is heavy, but has handle and wheels. Had a bad battery, but Champion Power replaced under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Caswell

customer_reviews.title: works exactly as specified.
customer_reviews.text: It assembled very easily and started with Propane on one push of the Start button. I purchased this to replace a pull-start McCulloch because of physical-limitations I have which make it is hard to start the pull-start unit. In addition a physically smaller unit has its advantages. I needed both the button start and the dual fuel and this was the best unit on the market. I am very pleased with in.
customer_reviews.author: Dale N. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Wow.. Very Pleased! Quiet and smooth!
customer_reviews.text: Took about 30 minutes to set up. Read the directions carefully and just go step by step because the break in period is important! I hooked up the battery, added the standard (not synthetic) 10-30 wt oil for break in per the instructions. Hooked up my propane tank and Bam.. started right up! I have it running the AC on one of my RVs and charging the other and it handles both just fine. Super quiet, super smooth, comparable to Honda and Yamaha's I've had experience with. I would buy another one no questions about it. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Rolling Home RV Rentals

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and run.
customer_reviews.text: I just got this and set it up and burned it in for the 5 hours at 50% or so duty cycle. Runs like a dream. Quiet enough for my needs. I ran it on propane which is how I plan to use it with my RV. I do wish it had come with the neutral/ground adapter for use with the RV but that's a minor nit. It ran the air conditioner, TV, and fridge during the burn in cycle no problem. Very happy with this generator.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Hamm

customer_reviews.title: Started and ran perfectly right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Use it to power a freezer and refrigerator at home during power outages and take it along on RV trips to power my travel trailer when not connected. No difficulty with first start and instructions were well written. Would have been nice to have a cover for the trailer included in the box. Also would have preferred a US made generator but its supposedly engineered and designed here so thats something I guess.
customer_reviews.author: D. Burton

customer_reviews.title: great stable generator, decent size and weight to watt ratio
customer_reviews.text: This is a very compact and well made generator. Voltage is really stable when the load increases. It has great gadgets like an oil spill slide underneath the oil plug so if you overfill it the excess oil doesn't accumulate inside the generator. I give it four stars because it didn't run out of the box. It came with a cracked spark plug, the support team guided me through the troubleshooting process with excellent attitude and a lot of patience. So for SUPPORT I GIVE THEM 10 STARS.
customer_reviews.author: pedro j lafee n

customer_reviews.title: Great unit but don’t forget a Bonding Plug for RV’s
customer_reviews.text: Dual fuel is great! Used continuously in AZ, TX and FL. Rain, hail heat and sun did not affect this unit. Powered my RV AC and trailer for about 6 hrs on gas and about 10 hours on LP. Needed to buy a Bonding Plug to make it work at the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Garren

customer_reviews.title: Dual Fuel out of the box
customer_reviews.text: First 5 hour break in period watching a movie was a success. Now it's time for the first oil change. Following all directions for best results. Operates beautifully on propane. Very clean burn. And my ol lady loves that she doesn't have to touch a gas can. So far we are very pleased. The cat even was able to sneak by the dogs for the first time in weeks thanks to the noise of the generator but we could here the cat meowing over the low decibel levels to let him in. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: Tebo

customer_reviews.title: Nicest Ive Owned
customer_reviews.text: I live in a motorhome- off grid and full time, and have had several generators. I use AC and a large microwave. this duel fuel inverter is by far the best ive ever purchased. In the future i will consider no other for replacment
customer_reviews.author: William G Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Still does everything it's advertised to do
customer_reviews.text: It's been over a year since I purchased this generator. It's got a few hundred hours on it. It has done everything I've asked it to do. I did an auxiliary tank mod to it with the pulse pump and the boat quick disconnect fittings when I first received it. Yesterday I burned up 6+ month old gas that was in the tank. Flipped the valve to freshly purchased gas and kept running. Did I mention the electric start worked after well over 6 months of sitting in my Camper Trailer storage compartment
customer_reviews.author: Casey the Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for camping after we had an power outage on a very hot day. I've wanted one for awhile for boondocking anyway. This seemed to fit the bill with the dual fuel capability. Haven't used it yet other than a test but powers our 15000 btu ac with no strain. I like that it runs on propane. We always have propane at the campsite and don't really want to haul gasoline around.
customer_reviews.author: SherrieB

customer_reviews.title: Great generator for the value. Lots of options. Champion must have listened to rv owners.
customer_reviews.text: Great generator for a rv. Has enough amps for my ac, heater, and microwave. Much quieter than I expected. On par with the noise level of a Honda. Starts easy. So far, the only fuel I have used is propane, and ran strong with it. Under load, there is no surging. I keep it in eco mode and it does the rest. Great generator with perfect options for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, Portable, Great Features
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Dual Fuel Generator Model 100263 for my 32 foot RV, it easily powered all. Beyond camping this will be a back-up in my driver for Hurricane season. Love this model, may not need gas at all, have several Propane tanks that can keep me cool and running. Design is great, easy to start (electric starter) has 30 amp RV plug, 2 120v plugs and even a lighter plug for charging mobile devices.Bonus is the ability to add a parallel generator for the future. Did I say I love this generator? I do!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Worked on the very first try
customer_reviews.text: We put it attached to the propane tank and push the electric start and started right up. Runs very quietly. We have tried the microwave and some lights with it but not yet tried the air conditioner on the travel trailer.. good value for the money. We looked at it because it was recommended and demonstrated on Lolo ho YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: jude

customer_reviews.title: This can run all night on one bbq propane tank.
customer_reviews.text: I got 12 hours on an exchange propane tank and 14 hours on my tanks filled at a propane dealer. It ran perfectly through a 3 day power outage using gasoline during the day (7 hour run time) and propane at night. I have no complaints, just a few suggestions: 1 bigger wheels. 2 stronger fold up handle. 3 some easier way to connect a float charger to the battery.
customer_reviews.author: M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Nice generator
customer_reviews.text: This is my second champion inverter generator. My first one was the 2000w version. Just set it up and ran it 5 hrs for break in on propane. Easy set up and started first crank. No problem. I'll update if an issue arises.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Romejko

customer_reviews.title: Great genny, but came with a bum battery.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our travel trailer. Works well on both propane and gas. Difficult to pull start when in a pinch. Starts up right away with the battery. However, our battery only lasted a few months even with starting every two weeks as indicated in the manual. Assume it was just a crappy battery to begin with, that's why it only gets there four stars. I've paired our new battery with a trickle charger to maintain the battery so we don't have to start it up every couple weeks.
customer_reviews.author: samhain0999

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This can take care of a 100 sq meters apartment easily. I have everything connected via the house's main circuit board (all but the air conditioners). I have had a couple of power outages since the installation and I'm satisfied. Since all my A/Cs runs on 220 v I can't use them, but, I'm willing to change the master bedroom A/C for a 110 v one and the generator can handle it for sure. 12.000 BTU 110 v A/C will consume around 10 amps, the generator can handle about 28-29 amps. Noise wise is a marvel, neighbors don't notice when is on.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Rosillon

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: So far the unit seems like it will work well for camping. I set it up and gave it a test run and it was flawless. It wasn’t loud but I thought it would be quieter although I have nothing to compare it to so it might just be me. It didn’t come with oil so I had to run out and get a quart. It wasn’t a big deal but I feel it should have come with it for convenance. It took a bit of cranking to start initially on propane but started quickly after that. All in all it is a good machine for the money assuming it lasts which people claim it does. Happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it is quieter than most.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product specifically to run a/c for rv camper. 15000 btu plus fridge and other 120 volt plugs. So far I’ve only used with propane and has gotten the job done. It really is much quieter than other less expensive models. It is easy to set up and use, especially with electric start. It comes with you propane hose. Started right out of the box once I added oil and connected battery. Go ahead and get yourself the digital timer for oil changes to make it even easier.
customer_reviews.author: Chol

customer_reviews.title: As Described
customer_reviews.text: I like this generator so far. Although I just received it, everything was well packaged and straight forward to get operational. After adding the 10w/30 oil and connecting the battery cables, I fired it right up using propane. It carries the advertised load and is very quiet. I will update if things change. So far it looks good though.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Broderick

customer_reviews.title: Love the dual fuel
customer_reviews.text: Bought the dual fuel 100263 primarily to use around our fifth wheel RV. Unboxing and setup was a snap. Connected LP tank and unit fired up first time. It couldn't be easier. Still working on the five hour break in period but so far no issues with the operation on this unit. On the down side, it would be an improvement if they would include an hour meter, fuel gauge, and digital output readings as do some of the other less expensive manufacturers do. Other then that is a solid unit with solid output, no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Corea

customer_reviews.title: Great for RV
customer_reviews.text: It’s been 7 months and I love my generators. Full time RV traveling across the country, saves us from hot temps in FL after a storm, powered us all night at a truck stop and have helped along the way. Run two for my large 5th wheel, got two AC’s, fridge, TV and all that jazz. Went all night on a tank of gas (8 hrs of sleep).
customer_reviews.author: CHB

customer_reviews.title: Dual fuel makes this the right choice for me!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for using when we dry camp. Used at home during our last power outage. Ran all night on 1 five gallon LP tank. Not super quiet but worth the trade off when you price the Hondas. A little heavy but the handle works great. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rubenski

customer_reviews.title: Best one I ever had before
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this generator I had an issue with the natural propane gas valve I called the company they send me a replacement with no questions asked quick. I would buy from this company another inverter
customer_reviews.author: Pete’s donut shack Wichita

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and get going
customer_reviews.text: I needed a generator for my RV trailer. After researching I chose the Champion duel fuel. So far I've set it up and taken it through the beak in period, but it seems to work great. It's very quiet in my opinion. For the break in I had it closer to my RV than I probably would if I was out boon-docking or something. Still, when my RV AC was on, I could not hear the generator. It was barely noticeable otherwise..
customer_reviews.author: roger wtaylor

customer_reviews.title: Best RV power I've found and it is Dual fuel to boot...
customer_reviews.text: This gen-set is the best I've found for my RV. It will even start and run our 15,000 BTU roof AC unit running on propane! Weighs less than 100 pounds without gasoline in it and has wheels and a carry handle. Highly recommended. Also as quiet as any this powerful, which is very quiet. Comes with electric start and already set up for RV 30 amp plug.
customer_reviews.author: Rob H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Generator
customer_reviews.text: Excellent generator. Powers 5th wheel camper with no problem. Runs 15K air conditioner on propane in economy mode. Used this generator to also power house during power outage. Worked perfectly - ran TV, Cable/Modem and fridge. Excellent shipping with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Small enough and light enough to use when one gets older.
customer_reviews.text: Although I had to add an hour-meter, I still like these generators. I have used propane only, but gas is an option. The shutdown method of stopping the flow of fuel is a wise idea. No more gummed up carburetors caused by forgetting to shut off flow. Using the parallel kit is a nice feature. Bought the wall feed-through kit so my wife has easy access to power if I am not home when she loses electricity. I think the most convenient thing is that I can still pick up a generator and put it on a wagon and pull it out to the field if I need power a long distance from the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup. Battery arrived fully charge. Love the handle wheels. Wouldn’t want to pull it a mile but great for moving around, my Honda with out wheels was real pain. Replace Honda EU3000is which burn up when overload protection failed. Honda was eight years old too expensive to repair. Using propane started right up(easy to over choke). At this point I would say it’s as good as the Honda and a whole lot cheaper. Install hour meter easy and also purchased expensive magnetic oil dip stick
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R Tanczos

customer_reviews.title: Good quality generator at decent price!
customer_reviews.text: Quality appears very good and documentation is excellent. They even provided a little funnel to aid in oil changes which was great as oil filler port is inside and hard to get to. Only problem I had was fuel running out the bottom! This turned out to be a drain port that wasn’t closed. This is a little screw at the base of the carb bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Lance T.

customer_reviews.title: Great unit
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, July 21 2020. Did the 5 hr break on, took camping for 3 days, not so efficient running the A/C off the propane side I have a 13,500 BTU A/C but when the tank ran out I switched over to the gas side, and it barely sipped fuel running the A/C unit in 100 degree weather. Chugged a little on initial setup but nothing after the fact. Eco mode is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Worked great right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were very detailed and clear. Added oil, hooked up the battery, hooked up the propane tank, choked it and pushed the starter and it fired up. Let it warm up for a bit and then plugged in the RV and turned on the AC unit and the generator chugged right along. Have used it about 6 times now and let it run with load on propane for about an hour or so each time. It has performed well. Very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: D&S

customer_reviews.title: Very Quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit. I burned it in with regular 10W 30 weight then changed it to 5W 30 Mobil One full synthetic, same as my Harley. I added a digital hour meter (just wrap the wire around the spark plug wire) and also a waterproof SAE plug to the battery, so I can plug a battery tender or solar charger right in to it. My last improvement will be the magnetic aluminum dipstick to pick up any fine particles from the rings seating...
customer_reviews.author: JudgeGarry

customer_reviews.title: Amazing machine
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my needs and I love that it runs on propane. Super quiet. Had a damaged regulator on delivery which I had a response from support within 2 hours and a new regulator in 2 days. Excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Davis

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Go propane! Got tired of draining gas and rebuilding carbs on gas powered machines. Quieter than any generator I’ve owned to-date. Built a custom rack with lock to hook to my trailer. Easy start and my wife loves it too.
customer_reviews.author: John Hankinson

customer_reviews.title: Worked Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Took on our first RV excursion 5 days with no water or electric at Rockville Festival, worked like a champ, we used propane there was 3 of us. We found we would need 2-40lb propane tanks would be perfect for those days to run AC and everything really we have a 24ft travel trailer with all the bells and whistles. We had no issues! Good Times!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Started right out of the box, after I added oil of course. On propane I’m getting at least 14 hours of run time. Since I live an area with regular power outages this generator does a great job. It’s quiet and very easy to use. My only complaint is there is no hour meter to help me gauge when maintenance is due. It makes no sense that Champion couldn’t of added something as necessary as an hour meter. Great product overall and I tell everyone that asks what kind of generator I have.
customer_reviews.author: D. Aguiar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Rvers
customer_reviews.text: We will use it for camping trips this season. The dual fuel and 30 amp rv plug a great ideas. The propane hose and regulater with holding clap is awsome. The battery switch, to save battery is great. Having a 12volt outlet is nice. The parallel option also a plus. I like the manual choke, someone was using there head. The propane quik connect also great idea. Just wish it had a fuel gauge and hour meter.
customer_reviews.author: norma

customer_reviews.title: Love the CLEAN LP Fuel option!
customer_reviews.text: We are retired RVers and use our travel trailer now as a guest room for visitors. During power outages from Hurricanes, we are now prepared to use our trailer powered by our new 3400 Watt Duel Fuel Inverter. Pros: Love ability to use clean LP Fuel instead of gasoline. Very easy to move around. Love the low noise level. Very easy to operate. Cons: only 2 so far. It should include an hour meter. I bought one and installed it myself. The very small wheels with very little clearance could be larger with more clearance. Small stones get wedged between wheels and frame when moving it. I would highly recommend this model to my RV friends.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Kostman

customer_reviews.title: champion dual fuel generator is just what i needed
customer_reviews.text: Got my 100263 Champion dual fuel generator from Amazon a week ago and after getting it ready with oil, it started perfectly with propane and gas!! It's as quiet as they claim and will serve my camper perfectly this summer while camping at the lake. Good price and about half the price of one of it's competitors!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THis generator is the real deal
customer_reviews.text: I spent the last month and a half searching generators to use while camping in a small trailer. While all of the different generators seemed like they would work fine I settled on this Champion generator. It will fit my needs perfectly and the reviews by other users made this decision a no brainier. We are leaving this weekend for a week long trip and I cannot wait to fire this generator up and use it.
customer_reviews.author: That Healthy Friend

customer_reviews.title: Champion Duel generator
customer_reviews.text: This is a great generator for RV use while dry camping. It uses gasoline OR LP, no need to carry gas! It was just a little quieter than expected and is every bit 100 lbs but has a nice sturdy handle and wheels for maneuverability. Definitely would recommend
customer_reviews.author: CLS57

customer_reviews.title: Runs great on propane
customer_reviews.text: I like that this starts quickly and runs great on propane and I don't have to carry gasoline around with me in the camper. Started right up out of the box and ran smooth. Hopefully the quality will last but it has a 3 year warranty so that's hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Real Jeep

customer_reviews.title: Inspect carefully.
customer_reviews.text: Although shipping box looked ok, corner of generator was cracked...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FYI: Cannot pull-start generator in gasoline mode with bad battery
customer_reviews.text: Everything works fine, but for one disappointment. I bought this model, thinking the recoil starter would backup a failing battery. Recently, I could not pull-start the generator after neglecting the battery for a whole year. The battery voltage was 9.8 volts (all my fault). Champion "support" said 12 volts were necessary to pull-start the generator when using gasoline, but not when using propane. This important information should be in Champion's pre-sales literature and owner's manual. I would have bought the recoil-start only option if I had known this quark. The recoil-starter is a worthless feature to me now. I wonder if the single-fuel models are designed similarly.
customer_reviews.author: jgleason

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: This Generator has been a lifesaver for me, and my mobile grooming business during the summer heats. I use this generator to operate my air-conditioning unit. Without it I would not be able to work during this record breaking California heat wave.
customer_reviews.author: Dro

customer_reviews.title: Great generator.
customer_reviews.text: I have 50 hours (with a mix of propane and gasoline use) on this gen and it is outstanding. Using it as a backup for my solar system for bookdocking and adventure camping in remote areas. Plenty of power to run all of my campers equipment when needed. It is a bit louder than a Honda but half the price AND dual fuel.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: the Dual fuel feature is my favorite we are using it with our trailer For dry ...
customer_reviews.text: the Dual fuel feature is my favorite we are using it with our trailer For dry camping. We don't need to have gasoline with us just hook up to the trailer propane. We run it in a compartment in the trailer we can't hear it. I built a fireproof vented cover.. I wish the handle detached easier although it is just four bolts. You can't go wrong with this unit fuel runs for hours on 30 lb tank we use it mainly to keep fridge and freezer working.they are full residential.
customer_reviews.author: ross blair

customer_reviews.title: Must have received a lemon
customer_reviews.text: Running on gasoline and electric start feature stopped working after a month of very limited use. Need to contact manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Great Inverter Generator
customer_reviews.text: I love this inverter generator. 15 minutes out of the box and I was running my RV. AC, TV, Microwave, Lights, Refridgerator, water pump. The only reason I didn't rate it 5 stars all the way is it weighs about 100 lbs and the wheels could be a little bigger. Operation of the gen. is great and surprisingly quiet. At 50' away in the house you can't hear it. Update: Does not come with any oil and you MUST put oil in before running.
customer_reviews.author: srheug

customer_reviews.title: Did the job!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this due to the 2019 PSPS shutdowns and to give us boondock capability for our RV. Easy to start up and provides more then enough standby power. The dual fuel feature will give us more versatility. The only slight was it wasn't silent but met our expectations though. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: cenvalleysteel

customer_reviews.title: this worked great. Of course it makes noise but it's not ...
customer_reviews.text: We have a 32' travel trailer, this worked great. Of course it makes noise but it's not screaming loud, it's more of a hum. It ran our roof top single air conditioning unit along with the microwave and one 32" tv at the same time just fine but seems to go through gas pretty quick.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Good power - very versatile
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for the money. It wasn't super quiet, but I've definitely seen much louder units. This one is quieter than most. I love the dual fuel option, too. We used this with a 29ft. travel trailer and it was able to power fridge, microwave, and AC all at the same time. Lots of plug in options, and I was able to get a quick-connect hose and run it straight off the trailer's propane supply. (not included with the unit)
customer_reviews.author: Gordon F. Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This generator does exactly what I needed. It will run the ac in my travel trailer and everything else. We have not tried it with the ac and a hair dryer, but probably wouldn't do them both at the same time anyway. It starts easily and I have run ot on propane only, no gasoline yet. It is surprisingly quiet.
customer_reviews.author: JayR

customer_reviews.title: Should have got a brand new generator!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this generator to power my RV at a Nascar race using propane. I ran the generator for the weekend and it gave me no problems running my camper and was very quiet. Problems I encountered was the unit came it was covered in motor oil and some white powder, and the battery was dead after spending $90 on a new battery and it still did not start I decided to return it. I am planning on purchasing again but I'm going to get brand new and I'm going to get it a little earlier than I did this one
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and in perfect condition. The handles make lifting it up into my truck much easier. I have a camper with a 15,000btu AC and the generator is able to power the AC and fridge in the hot Florida sun with no problems in both the propane and gasoline modes.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph W Slattery

product_meta.title: Champion 3400-Watt Dual Fuel RV Ready Portable Inverter Generator with Electric Start
product_meta.description: The Champion Power Equipment 100263 3400-Watt Portable Inverter Generator is the perfect combination of versatility and convenience whether you need power for your home, RV or project. The convenient electric start includes a battery, plus Cold Start Technology ensures a quick start in cold weather. Connect your sensitive electronics with confidence since this inverter produces only Clean Power (˂ 3% THD). Designed for safety with a low oil shut-off sensor, this inverter has a 0.6-quart oil capacity (recommended 10W-30). Operate your Dual-Fuel generator right out of the box on gasoline or propane, and easily switch fuels with a quick turn of the fuel selector dial. Using gasoline, the 192cc Champion engine produces 3400 starting watts and 3100 running watts, and will run for 7.5 hours at 25% load. It produces 3060 starting watts and 2790 running watts, and will run for 14.5 hours at 25% load when using a 20-pound propane tank. Champion’s Inverter Technology includes smart Economy Mode, which can reduce the electrical load, providing quieter operation, extended engine life and better fuel economy. Included are a 120V 30A RV (TT-30R), two 120V 20A household outlets (5-20R), a 12V DC automotive-style outlet with dual USB adapter, plus a propane hose with a built-in regulator. Operates at 59 dBA from 23 feet – about the same noise level as normal conversation. The optional Parallel Kit provides a quick clip-on connection which allows you to increase output by connecting up to two 2800-watt or higher inverters. Also included is a standard 50-amp RV outlet with power to start and run two 15,000 BTU RV air conditioners. Fully assembled with foldaway handle for easy storage and built-in handles and never-flat tires for easy transport. Buy this EPA certified and CARB compliant generator with confidence – Champion Support and our nationwide network of service centers will back up your purchase with a 3-year limited warranty and FREE lifetime technical support.
feature_bullets: Dual Fuel – Operate your 3400-watt portable generator right out of the box on either gasoline or propane, plus the unit holds 0.6-quarts of oil (recommended 10W-30) and has a low oil shut-off sensor

Ultra-Quiet Operation – 59 dBA is perfect for RVs, tailgating, your next project or backup power for your home, featuring 3400 starting watts and 3100 running watts with up to 7.5 hours run time on gasoline
Clean Power for Sensitive Electronics – RV Ready with a 120V 30A RV, plus two 120V 20A household outlets with clean electricity (less than 3% THD) and 12V DC outlet with dual USB adapter
Champion Support – Includes 3-year limited warranty with FREE lifetime technical support from dedicated experts
Convenient Electric Start with 3-Position Ignition Switch – Battery included, plus Quick Touch Panel allows you to access all your controls in one spot.Noise Level :59 dBA at 23 feet. Frequency 60 Hz

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars856 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
